original_title: Sri Lanka’s mid day shares edge down
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid day trade on Thursday, shares were down on the financial year coming to an end, an analyst said.
“The market is down as financial years come to an end and investors await reports to be produced,” an analyst said.
All Share Price Index was down 0.24 percent  or 22.31 points to 9,250.12, the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 0.06 percent or 1.66 points to 2,671.59.
Top losers during mid day trade were DFCC, Sri Lanka Telecom and Hayleys.
Profit taking had been witnessed in Sri Lanka Telecom as the Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval in principle for the divestment of the stakes held by the Treasury Secretary.
There had been buying interest for Lanka IOC as global oil prices have come down, pushing the interest for the index up.
Selling pressures have decreased on banks and stability is coming back in as the share price has gone down, which has pitched in buying interest for the index, an analyst said. (Colombo/Mar30/2023)
